title: When rock stars crash: why are tour buses so dangerous?
text:
Late last month John Baizley revisited roads on which he almost lost his life. The singer and guitarist with the American heavy metal band Baroness rode through the Somerset countryside aboard a tour bus, just as he had seven years earlier. This time he didn’t wake up surrounded by doctors who spoke of amputating his arm.

On the morning of August 15 2012 Baroness were en route to a concert in Southampton. While writing reports of the previous night’s show John Baizley looked up from his laptop and saw a road sign warning that an approaching hill featured a declining gradient of 12 per cent, a trajectory far too steep for the vehicle in which he was travelling.
